result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Owen C Doerre

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorney

Defendant Owen C Doerre in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Owen C Doerre.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Owen C Doerre. Attorney Ahmad taking over representation. On for plea and client not accepting current offer. Attorney Dickinson to be relieved, substitution to be filed. Attorney Ahmad to obtain discovery. Expunction is part not in current offer. Set over 45 days. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Owen C Doerre in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Owen C Doerre.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Owen C Doerre in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Owen C Doerre. Called @ 3:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference. Record by Atty. Dickinson as to status of matter and need for one more status. Court sets as requested.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:25 PM (64-06)  Defendant Owen C Doerre in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Owen C Doerre.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Samuel Barrett.
Samuel Barrett duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness identified the defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:29PM - Cross examination by Attorney Dickinson.
2:34PM - Argument by ADA Herrmann. Requesting court bind over.
2:34PM - Argument by Attorney Dickinson. Objecting to bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Dickinson acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Adj. 2:36PM
Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Owen C Doerre in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Owen C Doerre. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Preliminary hearing, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
